page.title: 16A PROBUS HOUSEWIFE'S DAY
page.content: A PROBUS HOUSEWIFE'S DAY. I have lived in Probus for about 30 years & we live in the last remaining thatched cottage.My day starts at 7:00am preparing breakfast for my husband,who is head gardener at Trewithen,& my 2 girls.Sharon,the eldest,catches a bus to school & I walk with Emma to her school just up the road.On Thursdays my mother & I go shopping in Truro & I return home to cook the midday meal.I tidy up & then pick strawberries locally & prepare them for freezing.I collect Emma at 3:40 & when everyone is home by 5:00pm we have tea.I help Emma with her spellings.The girls watch Top of the Pops & then go to bed.I now have time to read the local paper,watch television & go to bed after a busy day.
